info.title: Code Quality API
info.description: Provides APIs to submit code analysis requests and retrieve information about code quality findings, application scores, and analysis results.

servers.description: Replace ODC_PORTAL_DOMAIN with the domain of your organization.
Replace {odc-portal-domain} with the domain of your organization.

get.summary: Retrieves the details of a code analysis request.
get.description:
Retrieves the current status and results of a code analysis request, including quality score and findings.



Example: GET /code-quality/v1/code-analyses/be77b25f-c738-462f-8f19-7114fc4f9923

API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

parameters.name: analysisKey
parameters.description: The unique identifier (GUID) of the analysis request

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: Number of findings to return in the response.

parameters.name: Offset
parameters.description: Number of findings to skip for pagination.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

post.summary: Submits a code analysis request for an asset revision.
post.description:
Initiates code analysis for a specific asset revision, returning an analysis key for status tracking.



Example: POST /code-quality/v1/code-analyses

API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > Manage Code Quality findings** permission.

requestBody.description: The analysis request containing the asset key and revision to analyze

post.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > Manage Code Quality findings** permission.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of code quality findings.
get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of code quality findings with comprehensive filtering, sorting, and field selection capabilities.



Example: GET /code-quality/v1/findings?assetKeys=abc123&severities=High&status=Open&limit=20

API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

parameters.name: IsLatest
parameters.description: Filter to return only findings from the most recent analysis snapshot.

parameters.name: Fields
parameters.description: Select specific fields to return in the response.

parameters.name: Since
parameters.description: Start date for filtering findings by discovery time.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: End date for filtering findings by discovery time.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return per page.

parameters.name: Offset
parameters.description: Number of records to skip for pagination.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

get.description:
Retrieves quality metrics and findings distribution for assets, including quality scores and findings grouped by severity and status, with comparison to previous analysis.



Example: GET /code-quality/v1/assets-quality-metrics?assetType=Application&limit=50&sort=-score

API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

parameters.name: Since
parameters.description: Start date for filtering findings by discovery time.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: End date for filtering findings by discovery time.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return per page.

parameters.name: Offset
parameters.description: Number of records to skip for pagination.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

get.summary: Retrieves the analysis summary for an asset revision.
get.description:
Retrieves the analysis summary for a specific asset revision, including findings breakdown by severity and the quality score.



Example: GET /code-quality/v1/assets/53fcbdc7-be3c-4532-866c-a296336133b0/revisions/8/analysis-summary

API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

parameters.name: assetKey
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the asset

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The revision number of the asset to retrieve analysis for

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

get.description:
Retrieves a multi-dimensional summary of findings, aggregated by customizable grouping parameters such as category, status, and severity.



Example: GET /code-quality/v1/findings-summary?groupBy=Category,Status,Severity&categories=Security

API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

parameters.name: GroupBy
parameters.description: Grouping parameters for organizing the findings summary.

parameters.name: FetchChange
parameters.description: Include changes compared to previous analysis.

parameters.name: Since
parameters.description: Start date for filtering findings by discovery time.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: End date for filtering findings by discovery time.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return per page.

parameters.name: Offset
parameters.description: Number of records to skip for pagination.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

get.summary: Retrieves historical trend data for findings.
get.description:
Retrieves historical trend data for findings over time, showing how findings and quality scores evolved across analyses. Useful for visualizing trends and patterns over time.



Example: GET /code-quality/v1/findings-trend?assetKeys=abc123&since=2024-01-01&to=2024-12-31

API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

parameters.name: Since
parameters.description: Start date for filtering findings by discovery time.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: End date for filtering findings by discovery time.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return per page.

parameters.name: Offset
parameters.description: Number of records to skip for pagination.

get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of code patterns.
get.description:
Returns a paginated list of all available code patterns that can be detected during code analysis, including their names, descriptions, and metadata.



Example: GET /code-quality/v1/patterns?limit=50

API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.
get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

get.summary: Retrieves details for a specific code pattern.
get.description:
Returns detailed information about a specific code pattern, including its description, category, severity, and detection rules.



Example: GET /code-quality/v1/patterns/pattern-id-123

API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.
get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

get.summary: Retrieves the current synchronization status of Code Quality data.
get.description:
Retrieves the current synchronization status of Code Quality data, including the latest and last successful analysis details with metrics about new and resolved findings.



Example: GET /code-quality/v1/analysis-status

API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.
get.x-os-permissions: API Client needs the **AI Mentor System > View Code Quality findings** permission.

assetKey.description: Unique identifier of the asset to analyze.

assetRevision.description: Revision number of the asset to analyze.

AppsOverviewResponseV1.title: AppsOverviewResponse

score.title: ScoreChange
score.description: Quality score with change compared to previous analysis.

severity.description: Findings count grouped by severity level (Low, Medium, High, Critical).

status.description: Findings count grouped by status (Open, Resolved, Dismissed, Snoozed, Closed).

AppsOverviewResponseV1.description: Overview response for an asset, including quality scores and findings distribution by severity and status.

AppsOverviewResponseV1PagedListResponse.description: Represents a response containing a paged set of results.

summary.title: FindingsSummary
summary.description: Overview of Finding Summary by categories and severities

CodeAnalysisCategories.title: CodeAnalysisCategories

security: Findings Count grouped by severity level (Low, Medium, High, Critical)

performance.title: SeverityBreakdown
performance.description: Findings Count grouped by severity level (Low, Medium, High, Critical)

architecture.title: SeverityBreakdown
architecture.description: Findings Count grouped by severity level (Low, Medium, High, Critical)

maintainability.title: SeverityBreakdown
maintainability.description: Findings Count grouped by severity level (Low, Medium, High, Critical)

CodeAnalysisCategories.description: Finding Counts for all analysis categories and severities

summary.title: FindingsSummary
summary.description: Overview of Finding Summary by categories and severities

latestFindingsCount.description: Number of findings in the current/latest analysis.

findingsDifferenceCount.description: Change in findings count compared to previous analysis.

FindingsResponseV1PagedListResponse.description: Represents a response containing a paged set of results.

FindingsSummary.title: FindingsSummary

categories.title: CodeAnalysisCategories
categories.description: Finding Counts for all analysis categories and severities

FindingsSummary.description: Overview of Finding Summary by categories and severities

latestFindingsCount.description: Number of findings in the current/latest analysis.

findingsDifferenceCount.description: Change in findings count compared to the previous analysis.

FindingsSummaryResponseV1.title: FindingsSummaryResponse

totalFindings.title: FindingsSummaryMetricResponse
totalFindings.description: Total count of findings across all groups.

results.description:
Hierarchical breakdown of findings grouped by the requested parameters (e.g., Category  Status  Severity).

Each level contains either nested groups (as dictionaries) or leaf metrics with count information.

The structure depth and keys depend on the GroupBy parameter specified in the request.

FindingsSummaryResponseV1.description: Summary response containing total findings count and hierarchical breakdown based on grouping parameters.

openFindingsCount.description:
Represents the count of open findings for the specified day.

This property is used to track the number of findings that are still open on that day.

snoozedFindingsCount.description:
Represents the count of snoozed findings for the specified day.

This property is used to track the number of findings that are still snoozed on that day.

resolvedFindingsCount.description:
Represents the count of resolved findings for the specified day.

This property is used to track the number of findings that are still resolved on that day.

dismissedFindingsCount.description:
Represents the count of dismissed findings for the specified day.

This property is used to track the number of findings that are still dismissed on that day.

closedFindingsCount.description:
Represents the count of closed findings for the specified day.

This property is used to track the number of findings that have been closed on that day.

analysisDate.description:
Represents the day of the findings trend data.

The format is typically "YYYY-MM-DD".

startedOn.description: The date and time of when the analysis started

completedOn.description: The date and time of when the analysis finished

newFindingsCount.description: The count of the new findings

solvedFindingsCount.description: The count of the solved findings

LatestAnalysisV1.title: LatestAnalysis

startedOn.description: The date and time of when the analysis started

completedOn.description: The date and time of when the analysis finished

newFindingsCount.description: The count of the new findings

solvedFindingsCount.description: The count of the solved findings

errorCode.description: The error code returned in case the latest analysis has failed status

errorMessage.description: The error message returned in case the latest analysis has failed status

LatestAnalysisV1.description: Represents the latest analysis (may include error information)

scheduledOn.description: The date and time of when the analysis was scheduled to run

count.description: Number of results in the current page.

offset.description: Offset of the current page of results.

nextPageOffset.description: Offset of the next page of results.

PageInfoWithTotals.description: Contains response page information including totals.

PatternsResponsePagedListResponse.description: Represents a response containing a paged set of results.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation of the error.

instance.description: A URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

traceId.description: This field helps OutSystems support track and investigate specific error occurrences. Providing this identifier when reporting an issue allows for more precise and faster troubleshooting.

errorCode.description: This error code serves the purpose to communicate with OutSystems Support and help diagnose errors.

ProblemDetails.description: A standardized error response as per RFC 7807 (Problem Details for HTTP APIs).

latestScore.description: Quality score from the current/latest analysis (0-100).

differenceScore.description: Change in quality score compared to previous analysis.

SeverityBreakdown.title: SeverityBreakdown
SeverityBreakdown.description: Findings Count grouped by severity level (Low, Medium, High, Critical)

lastSuccessfulAnalysis.title: LastSuccessfulAnalysis
lastSuccessfulAnalysis.description: Info about the latest successful analysis

result.title: StatusAnalysisResponseResult
result.description: The result of the status sync

bearerAuth.description: Enter your bearer token in the format 'Bearer {token}'
